dsDescriptionValue.value: Sample of synoptic magnetic field and corresponding uncertainty maps for Carrington rotations 2093 and 2137

publicationCitation.value: Bertello, L., Pevtsov, A.A., Petrie, G.J.D., Keys, D.: 2013, "Uncertainties in Solar Synoptic Magnetic Flux Maps", Solar Physics, 289, issue 7, 2419-2431

fields.value: CR2093.fts CR2137.fts fits files have two planes (magnetic flux and errors). Additional information about NISP/SOLIS synoptic maps can be found here. In addition, we provide two data sets used to test how the uncertainties in a synoptic magnetic flux map may affect the calculation of the global magnetic field of the solar corona (Figures 5-6 in the reference paper). Each data cube contains 100 synoptic maps created by additing random errors within the derived standard deviations to the observed synoptic magentic flux map. These data cubes are available as cr2104_cube.fts and cr2137_cube.fts. Each file contains 100 maps, with the first being the original map (without error). No polar filling has been applied to the maps.
